programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes leads Chiefs to 26-7 playoff win over Dolphins in near-record low temps, the fourth-coldest game in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs

programme.title: Knee Deep
programme.desc: A nerdy girl gets deep into street life and becomes a cold force to be reckoned with.

programme.title: What a Day Before Christmas
programme.desc: Nathan and Naomi are at odds about the direction of their marriage, and reluctance to get in the Christmas Spirit is shown by Nathan. As an ultimatum, it is insisted by Naomi that the holidays are spent by Nathan with her and her family, but it is Christmas Eve. The help of Nathan's cousin Keith is enlisted, and a road trip is embarked upon by the two as they race against time. An attempt is made to get home for the holidays and save the marriage.

programme.title: Mixed Christmas
programme.desc: Aurora wants to enjoy the holidays this year in some warmth and sunshine, and invites her three best friends to Miami for a Christmas trip to remember. When they arrive at their AirBnb, they discover it's been double booked by Aurora's ex-girlfriend and her new partner Axel. They have no choice but to combine their plans, and celebrate the holiday together.

programme.title: Cooperating Criminals
programme.desc: Tony's ambition ignites a powder keg of betrayal. Driven by Bianca's manipulation, he pushes his pill operation, ignoring Jay's warnings. As DEA Agent Harrison closes in, Jay battles his past to protect Tony. A dangerous deal with Marco, escalates the chaos, leading to overdose and murder plots. Now, Tony faces a stark choice: witness or prison.

programme.title: Apex
programme.desc: A special ops team enters a secret bunker called Hades to retrieve missing scientists, only to uncover a horror far beyond what they expected.

programme.title: Holiday Heist
programme.desc: College student Raymond's relaxed holiday plans are upended when his divorced parents, Marcus and Hope, arrive early for their annual Christmas tradition. Just as they're about to leave and Raymond's friends are due, a massive snowstorm traps everyone inside. The chaos escalates when they discover Hope's new boyfriend, Greg, is a con artist who's swindled them all. Forced to unite, Marcus and Hope put aside their differences to outwit Greg.

programme.title: Meli
programme.desc: Forced to take desperate measures to save her family, a young woman robs a stranger's home, unknowingly targeting someone far more dangerous.

programme.title: A Wonderful Lie
programme.desc: When a fading romance author goes missing, a team of investigators piece together clues that ultimately lead them to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: A Matter of Heart
programme.desc: Balen, a successful family man, risks everything for a reckless affair. His wife, Krista, faces a harsh reality as her sacrifices are tested. Enter Latricia, a ruthless temptress with no shame. A story that weaves a tale of emotional turmoil, family crisis, unwavering faith, and the destructive power of temptation. Will love or lust prevail?

programme.title: Swept
programme.desc: Buried secrets come to light and new relationships develop when five old friends reconnect at their 20-year high school reunion.

programme.title: Melted Lipstick
programme.desc: Magic comes with a steep price for a shrinking violet who’s given a special lipstick that has the power to transform her into anyone she desires.

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: Lost and grieving, Chris seeks solace in the wrong crowd. A chance encounter with the enigmatic Patrick leads him down a dangerous path, forcing him to confront his own morality and the consequences of his choices.

programme.title: Bruised 2
programme.desc: Two years after the death of her husband, Kayla Brown has rebuilt her life following the launch of her successful memoir. she is then visited by a stalker, who is hell-bent on making her pay for what she has done in order to escape her husband.

programme.title: CODE
programme.desc: Malik Schaefer, also known as Code, is a rising star in the underground rap scene, struggling with some issues. With the help of his best friend, Malik is back on the fast track to success, but when he meets Sophia, she threatens to ruin it all.

programme.title: Thicker the Berry, the Sweeter the Juice 2
programme.desc: A rising celebrity news reporter has to choose between new love or the safer route when an ex-boyfriend reappears in her life.

programme.title: What She Wants
programme.desc: Vannaleese Poole is a street smart, businesswoman who uses her talents to get what she wants. In her quest for power, she falls for two men and becomes embroiled in a web of jealous and deceit.

programme.title: Bars
programme.desc: A woman's idyllic world comes crashing down when she's sentenced to life in prison for a crime she didn't commit. She soon finds strength and solace among a group of tight-knit inmates known as the Pretty Girls.

programme.title: Ebony's Christmas Carol
programme.desc: A bitter winery owner is visited by three spirits who urge her to face the past and rediscover the joy she’s lost around the Christmas season.

programme.title: Festive Fling
programme.desc: After Shelly's painful divorce, she was left feeling like the black sheep of the family. Desperate to move on from the pain of her past, she invites her co-worker Greg to visit her family to pretend to be her boyfriend to deflect her family's unwanted comments. Little did she know, that her holiday fling, would become a holiday thing.

programme.desc: Burt Reynolds shows his vacation videos and talks about moving in next door to Barbra Streisand.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.desc: Johnny jokes about Gerald Ford and political slogans and sits down with Phyllis George.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.desc: Steve Lawrence sings, Rodney Dangerfield cracks up both Johnny and the audience, Christopher Reeve is hot off Superman, Susan Sarandon has a strange fear of bananas.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.desc: Johnny wonders if "abhor" is safe to say on television. Joan Embery of the San Diego Zoo brings out a seal and a baby gorilla. Albert Brooks is looking forward to the 1980s.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.desc: Richard Pryor discusses his recent trip to Zimbabwe and daily life since quitting drugs and alcohol.

programme.desc: Catch outrageous flirting as Angie Dickinson denies rumors about her and singer Julio Iglesias.

programme.desc: Wilt Chamberlain is leaving the Lakers, Michael Landon talks Bonanza, and Johnny Mathis sings "I'm Going Home."

programme.desc: Actor/Comedian Eddie Murphy shows an SNL clip in which he impersonates Bill Cosby.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Jackie faces problems at the Lunch Box and must take advice from an unexpected guest.

programme.desc: Becky introduces Tyler to Beverly Rose, but she is skeptical of Tyler’s approach.

programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: Charlie has to make a decision between keeping his group and being a sports psychologist for a baseball team.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: The first episode in which Charlie - a baseball player with anger issues turned anger management therapist - decides to return to therapy after a bad run-in with his ex wife's new boyfriend.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: The new "evolved" Charlie has to deal with a ghost from his old carousing, baseball-playing days when a unattractive woman he slept with just to break a batting slump shows up as a new patient in group therapy.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: Charlie challenges his group to do thirty-six hours of sleep deprivation therapy so that their "inhibitions come down and the truth comes out" - except the result turns out to be the exact opposite.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: Inflamed by Kate's comment that he's only "nouveau smart", Charlie starts covertly dating a brilliant coffee-shop barista. The only problem is that the woman is turned on by sex where there's a chance of getting caught -- and she's Kate's patient.

programme.desc: "Master Ninja II" (1983) Martial arts. The Master (Lee Van Cleef) searches the United States for his long-lost daughter. From the TV series.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gamera vs. Zigra" (1971) Science fiction. The big dual-exhaust turtle chucks a boulder onto the razor-sharp back of monster Zigra.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The police consult a metaphysicist to help solve a case; onboard the Satellite of Love, Mike and the Bots impersonate the Grateful Dead and Gypsy runs the crew through a fire drill.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Jack Frost" (1966) Kids. Grandfather Frost freezes a girl; a villager thaws her.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Icebreaker
programme.desc: The RiffTrax crew hits the slopes for this Die Hard on Skis with Sean Astin, a delightfully hammy Bruce Campbell and terrorists with a stolen nuke.

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: Dr. Frankenstein uses a sub-standard brain on his latest creature.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Deathstalker and the Warriors From Hell" a k a "Deathstalker III" (1989) Fantasy. A medieval hero (John Allen Nelson) meets twin princesses (Carla Herd) on a diamond quest.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "First Spaceship on Venus" (1960) Science fiction. International astronauts go to Venus and find what's left of a race that destroyed itself. With Yoko Tani, Oldrich Lukes, Ignacy Machowski.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Saddle up for a trip to a Mexican ranch with a nasty secret in this part-Western, part-monster movie.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: In Indestructible Man, a violent criminal named Butcher Benson is executed and becomes indestructible when he’s brought back to life . Butcher seeks revenge against those who caused his execution.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Santa Claus" (1959) Fantasy. Santa and Merlin save kids from the devil.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A boy magician, a boozy hero and a furry - something team up to save a kingdom.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A teenager's investigation into his father's death leads him to a hidden city populated with menacing warriors in "Final Sacrifice.".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Samson vs. the Vampire Women" (1961) Horror. The silver-masked Mexican wrestler refuses to submit.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A Russian hero plots an invasion against the Mongols in The Sword and the Dragon (1956). Mike and the Bots create their own topical comedy show, reenact the table cloth scene from the movie, and try their hand at playing Dungeons and Dragons.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Werewolf" (1996) Horror. Members of an isolated desert community become beasts when the moon is full.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Horror of Party Beach" (1964) Horror. Rockin' gilled monsters crash a beach bash; with John Scott; Alice Lyon.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Blood Waters of Dr. Z" (1972) Horror. A Florida scientist turns into a walking catfish. With Marshall Grauer and Wade Popwell.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G suspects that someone is responsible for a vagrant's unusual death. She'll only discover the truth by finding answers to the strange events surrounding this curious case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman is killed in a drunk driving accident. At first, her death seems to be an open-and-shut case, but Dr. G discovers clues that the woman may have played a key role in her own death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 69-year-old widower, Ernesto Vasquez is found dead on his porch with a loaded gun, a knife and three empty pill bottles.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In an unprecedented double autopsy, Dr. G is determined to find out who is accountable for these odd deaths and solve the mystery of a love triangle gone awry.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a man died as a result of his infected stab wound or if his history of drug abuse was the culprit.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: All circumstances point to foul play in the case of a dead hunter and the police fear that a killer is on the loose. Dr. G must provide them with answers before there are more victims.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman fears the worst when her aunt stops answering her calls. When her greatest fear is confirmed, Dr. G must determine one thing: was this a fatal fall?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a man died as a result of his infected stab wound or if his history of drug abuse was the culprit.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A florist meets with clients for an upcoming wedding, but she suddenly collapses to the floor. With no apparent cause of death, Dr. G worries that this case may go unsolved.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: To become America’s next Junior MASTERCHEF, the top 14 home cooks head to the great outdoors for a chicken cookout. programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Magnolias are the showstoppers of the tree world right now and to celebrate them in all their glory, James Alexander-Sinclair pays Borde Hill Garden in West Sussex, with its collection of magnificent champion trees, a visit.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Everything in the garden is shooting up so it's time to lift and divide perennials and Monty is doing just that with his ornamental grasses. In our third trip to South Africa, we discover where red hot pokers grow in the wild.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty's wildlife garden begins to take shape at Longmeadow, bees are very much at the forefront of his mind. He plants up a nectar-rich border that will attract all sorts of bees and other pollinating insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the hanging basket season well and truly underway, Joe Swift meets a florist in Surrey who has perfected the art of kokedama, a modern take on the hanging basket. Houseplants come under the spotlight too.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For the National Gardens Scheme, over 400 gardens in England and Wales will be opening to the public. Carol Klein visits one of them as they prepare for the big event. At Longmeadow a local beekeeper arrives with a swarm for Monty's new hive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift continues his quest to find the perfect hanging basket and comes up with his own design for a shady part of his garden. Monty Don has caught the bug too and demonstrates how to plant up an edible basket.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don celebrates the arrival of summer by making a start on his new scented border, and offers a few suggestions for what to be getting on with this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Plants that have a head for heights come under the spotlight. At Craigieburn Garden in the Scottish Borders there is a unique collection of Himalayan plants, plus a look at a nurseryman in Hebden Bridge who has been growing alpines since he was a teenager.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Joy of Painting

programme.title: Joy of Painting

programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds himself in Michigan again where he comes upon a pole barn full of Chevys and Fords that owner Denny has all sorts of stories about. Tom then heads to the other end of the state for some European sports car barn finds.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Unimogs, Mercedes 190E 2.3-16 and starting up a barn find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a long-time Mercedes mechanic and tours his collection of Unimogs and turbo diesel old Mercs. Next, Tom in is in the UK where he and a friend attempt to start a Morris Minor that hasn't run in over 20 years.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Merkur, Ford and the XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Revelations with Jason Cammisa feature untold stories of automotive legends. First, Jason tells the story of the Merkur XR4Ti and its Ford Sierra RS Cosworth cousin. Next, the Jeep Cherokee (XJ) takes center stage... as the best SUV ever?

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | GM muscle cars, rotary Mazdas, and Ford Broncos
programme.desc: Tom Cotter stumbles upon some GM muscle cars, including a Buick GS Stage 1 and some Oldmobile 442s. Next, Tom finds an interesting old Mazda RX-4 along with a stash of some vintage Ford Broncos.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Hertz 1966 GT350, and a 700HP Shelby GT500
programme.desc: Shelby expert Colin Comer appraises a 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz car with a period-correct Paxton Supercharger. And if that's not enough Carroll Shelby for you, Colin checks out a 700HP 1967 Shelby GT500 with TWO Paxton superchargers!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Mopars drag racing in the streets, plus a tour of Tom's barn finds
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some interesting barn finds in Northern Michigans, one of which leads to an impromptu drag race. Next, Tom gives us a tour of the barn find cars he's collected over the years.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Aspen F.A.T. Ice Race and a Review of the Audi R8 GT RWD
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole takes us to the F.A.T. Ice Race in Aspen, CO, which must be the coolest car event on the planet. Next, Henry jumps in what could be the last ever V10-powered Audi R8.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The NEW Ferrari Purosangue and Roma Spider
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives Ferrari's new V12-powered SUV in the mountains of northern Italy to try to decipher exactly what the Purosangue is all about.Next, Henry reviews the new Ferrari Roma Spider.

programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews a one-off McLaren P1 Spider and the new McLaren 750 S.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | On the Track with Some Serious Race Cars
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole is on the race track with the legendary Ferrari 458 GTE and the new Maserati MC20 GT2

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Modern Car Makeovers
programme.desc: Chip Foose gets to work on re-thinking the designs of a few recently updated models from Ford and BMW.

programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives and reviews the all-new Aston Martin Vantage with it's powerful V-8 engine.Next, Henry drives the all-new DB12, which represents the first of a new generation of the legendary DB nameplate.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Best-Sounding Drag Race
programme.desc: Lexus LFA vs Porsche Carrera GT vs Audi RS3The World's Heaviest Supercars square off in this episode of Ultimate Drag Race Replay - with the brand-new, 700-hp Ford F-150 Raptor R racing everything it can.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dusty Porsche 356 Speedster and an all-original Shelby GT500
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter talks with a woman with a dusty 1957 Porsche 356 A Speedster that she and her husband have owned since the 1960s. After that, Tom heads to his hometown and shows a stash of rare barn finds.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $900 Richard Petty engine, Ford Galaxies and a rare Mach 1 Mustang
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets "Snowball" Bishop, tours his personal junkyard, and gets some great stories about NASCAR and dirt track racing from the "good ol' days." Next, Tom gets the details on a rare Ford Mustang Mach 1 with a factory 429 Cobra Jet engine.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Prototype Mustang and a rare Mercury
programme.desc: Tom Cotter come across a prototype 1963 Ford Mustang that was specifically built for Henry Ford II. Next, Tom finds a gentleman with a driveway and garage packed full of oddball cars.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Classic Toyotas!
programme.desc: In this episode, watch as Chip Foose draws his creative take on the legendary Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser.Next, Chip moves onto another Japanese classic from the same manufacturer, the iconic little sportscar: the Toyota MR2.

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Greatest Japanese Car Collection in the World, plus a perfect R33 GT-R
programme.desc: Larry Chen has the opportunity to walk through and photography one of the most amazing collections of Japanese cars ever assembled. After that, Larry checks out Mine's and Built by Legends incredible R33 Nissan GT-R.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 365-ft barn, Jaguar E-Types, and a Vintage SCCA Race Car
programme.desc: Tom meets up with an old friend in South Carolina who shows him a barn full of Jaguars and so much more. Next, Tom travels to New England where he finds a Sunbeam Alpine with SCCA race history and more.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - BMW M3 and Fox-body Ford Mustang
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose brainstorms modifications to an E30 BMW M3.Part 2: Chip takes his pen to the notchback Foxbody Mustang and explores what it may have looked like if Carroll Shelby had a hand in the design

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Trucks and SUVs
programme.desc: Race 1: World's Quickest SUVs: Rivian R1S vs Aston DBX 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 2: Rivian R1T vs RAM TRX vs Aston DBC 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 3: Bronco Raptor vs G63 AMG vs Jeep Wrangler 392 vs Defender V8 vs Gallardo

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay - 2024 Mustang and 1990s Sedans
programme.desc: Race 1: 2024 Mustang Dark Horse vs Lotus Emira, M2, Supra, Camaro, ChallengerRace 2: The Fastest 5-Seaters of the 1990s - W124 500E v RS2 v M5 Touring + ND2

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - VW Beetle, Classic Mini, and a USPS Mail Truck
programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose uses his incredible drawing and design abilities to rethink and re-imagine the looks of the Volkswagen Beetle, classic Austin Mini Cooper, and... a USPS mail truck?

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | A Ferrari and a Ferrari-developed Maserati
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa wonders if the new Ferrari Roma is a return to the idea of an "everyday Ferrari." After that, Jason tells the fascinating story behind the Ferrari-developed Maserati Quattroporte V

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Wild Ferrari Restomod and the Oft-forgotten TVR Tuscan
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the gorgeous RML SWB Ferrari 250 GT restomod before jumping into an amazing car that most people may not be familiar with: the TVR Tuscan.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - AMC Pacer and "The Foosenberg"
programme.desc: Chip Foose reimagines the much maligned but legendary AMC Pacer as a custom delivery van.In part two of this program is a ""doozy!"" Chip explores the design of the legendary Deusenberg.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Broncos, Galaxies and a lifted Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds all sorts of interesting vehicles on a trip to Northern Michigan, from Ford Broncos to a unique Ford Galaxie. Speaking of Galaxies, hang around for a look at a Galaxie 500 that is back on the road after being a "barn find" itself!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The real reason Corvettes exist, plus some wild JDM cars
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a "baby Corvette," also known as the Opel GT. Next, he comes across in interesting collection of Japanese sports cars.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Hagerty and Henry Catchpole present the 2026 Bull Market List.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen | Daigo Saito and TJ Hunt
programme.desc: Larry Chen visits of of the greatest drift car garages in the world owned my driver Daigo Saito. After that, Larry visits TJ Hunt and gets the details on his GT-R-powered Ford Mustang.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Taycan GTS & Volkswagen ID. Buzz Review
programme.desc: Henry drives not one but two Porsches with a GTS badge on the back… and one will surprise you.Next, Henry jumps into the new Volkswagen ID. Buzz van and makes an attempt to turn it into a weekend camper.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | American Muscle
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours two of the most pristine collections of American muscle cars. His first stop is with Rich Fairservis and Garage Town Arizona. After that, Chris meets up with Gary McKay and his immaculate collection of Mustangs, Camaros and more!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Caterham Super Seven 600 and a Famous Old Bentley
programme.desc: In part 1 of this episode of The Driver’s Seat, Henry Catchpole drives the new Caterham Super Seven 600. After that, he has the extraordinary opportunity to drive Eddie Hall's Derby Bentley. Eddie Hall was the only driver to ever complete the 24 Hour

programme.title: 50 Years of Turbo | The Porsche 911 Turbo Documentary
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa and cohosts review 50 years of Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan

programme.title: The Appraiser | Ferrari Dino and Two Different Shelby Cobras

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and champion angler Meredith McCord explore public waypoints and attempt to land a world record amberjack on light line. Panama City Beach’s backyard is the site of an epic battle in the first of two amazing episodes.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh takes his friend Isaiah to the blue water as they look for destin's latest hot bite, the blackfin tuna.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick joins Capt. Dave DeGenarro as lightning quick bonito invade New Jersey waters for fast-paced, reel-burning action on light tackle.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew FINALLY make it to the Bahamas and the incredible Green Turtle Club for a week of fishing, diving, and exploring the Abaco Island chain. With two incredible boats at our disposal, we make the 200 mile crossings from Miami and Cape Canaveral to rendezvous at Green Turtle Cay. Stay tuned for Part one of our Bahamas adventure!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Green Turtle Cay adventure continues as the LK crew uncovers more of what the incredible out islands of the Bahamas have to offer. Shifting gears to bottom fishing, Ali catches a fish of a lifetime while Rush gets to dive and spearfish with the locals.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Back in San Diego and with Rockfish on the mind, the LK crew fish new grounds and depths to catch these iconic Southern California bottom fish. Along for the ride is pro snowboarder and friend Dave Downing to round out this epic rock cod fishing trip.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor join Captain Bryson Shaaber to fish the channels around Key West targeting big spring tarpon with live pinfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor launch out of Key Largo and fish their way up a creek filled with monsters.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Tony Young for a day of offshore fishing and free diving out of Islamorada.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head deep into the Everglades to target snook in the murky waters of Lake Ingraham.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor use Lowrance Active Target all day to find fish, first targeting bridge tarpon then finding a variety of species in Florida Bay mullet muds.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor chase Tarpon of all sizes around Florida Bay and the Everglades.

programme.title: The Captain's Log
programme.desc: It's late fall in Bonita Springs, Florida which means Captain Jonathan Moss and Captain Chris Argiro are chasing after nearshore Cobia.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With Season 6 in the can, Ali and Rush lookback on some of the places, catches, and memorable moments during this year of “new normal.”

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Key West. The pulse of the Keys- it’s known for bars, nightlife and history above water. But the underwater world here can be just as lively. From the beautiful, resilient coral reefs to the crown jewel of the keys - the USS Vandenburg.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew catches catfish and fries up seafood while they visit neighbors in the swamps before the cook up an iconic Cajun dish.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Chef Dave in the Golden Ilse to target Reds and Trout. Then head to Halyards to cook the catch.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: We sent Jay to the shark bite capital OF THE WORLD, it just so happens to be in our backyard. Watch Jay get shark bit in the scariest episode yet.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.
